entry.title: MarketSense AI: Real-Time Market Intelligence Agent
entry.summary:
This is a submission for the Bright Data AI Web Access Hackathon I created MarketSense AI, an intelligent agent that provides real-time market intelligence for investors, traders, and financial analysts. By continuously monitoring financial news, social media sentiment, and market data across multiple sources, MarketSense AI delivers actionable insights that help users make informed investment decisions.
Unlike traditional market analysis tools that rely on static or delayed data, MarketSense AI leverages Bright Data's infrastructure to access real-time information from across the web, ensuring users have the most current data available when making critical financial decisions.
Real-Time Financial News Aggregation: Continuously monitors and extracts relevant information from major financâ€¦

Integrates seamlessly into local workflows and CI pipeâ€¦

entry.title: How to Fix Unsupported Class File Major Version 61 in Flutter?
entry.summary: Introduction Are you struggling with the error message "Unsupported class file major version 61" when trying to run a Flutter project on your Apple Silicon Mac? If you've just installed Android Studio Canary version 2020.3.1.22 and are facing this issue with the default Flutter counter app, you're not alone. This frustrating error can occur due to compatibility issues between your Java Development Kit (JDK) version and Gradle settings, especially on ARM architecture. Understanding the Issue The error message indicates a misalignment between the JDK version you are using and the Gradle version that your Flutter project is trying to utilize. Specifically, major version 61 corresponds to Java 17, which is not compatible with older versions of Gradle, such as 6.7 that you are currently using. â€¦

entry.title: Quick Integration Solution for Local Applications in Buildroot on the Allwinner A40i Platform
entry.summary: In embedded system development, quickly and seamlessly integrating proprietary applications into the Buildroot image is crucial for accelerating product iteration. Taking the Allwinner A40i platform as an example, this article walks you through the full process of creating a package directory, writing Config.in and .mk build scripts, and enabling your local application via the board-level defconfig. Buildroot is essentially an automated build framework. Although build scripts for well-known open-source packages such as U-Boot and the Linux kernel are maintained by the community, you'll often need to add your own custom app_pkg packages to build and integrate your proprietary applications. Buildroot offers a framework of functions and variable commands. Build scripts like app_pkg.mk, writteâ€¦

entry.title: Notes from a Quiet Developer
entry.summary: Iâ€™m not the loudest in meetings. I donâ€™t always have something clever to say. For a long time, I thought that made me less valuable â€” like I should â€œspeak up moreâ€ or â€œdrive the room.â€ But hereâ€™s the thing: Quiet devs fix bugs before they become drama. Quiet devs write the docs others forget. Quiet devs bring calm when everyone else is reacting. If thatâ€™s you, donâ€™t think you have to change to match the noise. â€“ Serguey Asael Shinder

I recommend everyone to be cautious of data structures and algorithms (DSA) and hardware specifics, often sprinkled with hardware terminology. I was neither a specific computer science major nor a math specialist, just a stubborn curiosity and a job that demanded I figure it out. Terms like "BST," "B-tree," and "LSM tree" hit me like a wall of jargon and confusion, leaving me wondering if Iâ€™d ever crack the code. But hereâ€™s the thing: once I got my handâ€¦

entry.title: Designing Real-Time Systems
entry.summary:
Designing Real-Time Systems
Introduction: Real-time systems (RTS) are software applications designed to react to inputs within a specified timeframe. Unlike typical applications, the correctness of a RTS depends not only on the logical result but also on the time it takes to produce that result. Designing these systems requires careful consideration of timing constraints and resource management. Prerequisites: Designing efficient RTS demands expertise in several areas. Strong programming skills in languages like C or C++ are essential, alongside a solid understanding of operating systems, particularly real-time operating systems (RTOS) like FreeRTOS or VxWorks. Knowledge of hardware architectures, especially concerning memory management and interrupt handling, is also crucial. Furthâ€¦

entry.title: NFT founder stole millions from Bitcoin project, investors allege
entry.summary: Several investors in a non-fungible token (NFT) project, Hashling NFT, have accused its founder of misappropriating millions of dollars in profits from the project and a closely tied Bitcoin mining operation. According to the May 14 court filing in Illinois, the plaintiffs allege that their former business partner, Jonathan Mills, lied about transferring assets from Hashling NFT and at least $3 million from the Bitcoin mining project to a holding company â€” Satoshi Labs LLC (formerly known as Proof of Work Labs LLC), which Mills is the founder and CEO of. The plaintiffs have sued Mills for fraud and breach of fiduciary duty, claiming that they have not received any of the equity returns that he supposedly promised.Â They also claim to have raised a combined $1.46 million from two NFT drops â€¦

entry.title: Sonic Labs wins judgment for Multichain Foundation to wind up
entry.summary: A Singapore High Court has ruled in favor of Sonic Labsâ€™ motion to force the Multichain Foundation to wind up in an effort to recover funds stolen during a 2023 hack. In the May 9 judgment in the Singapore Supreme Court, Justice Kwek Mean Luck granted a request from Sonic Labs, formerly the Fantom Foundation, to declare Multichain bankrupt and appoint liquidators from global audit, tax and advisory service KPMG. Sonic Labs CEO Michael Kong said in a May 14 statement to X that the team behind the layer 1 Sonic blockchain felt it had no choice but to file a lawsuit to forcibly wind up Multichain because its former employees were being â€œcompletely uncooperativeâ€ and â€œhid from victims.â€ â€œGoing forward, the liquidators can now start working with other parties to initiate the process of trying tâ€¦

Joining her onstage was Democratic Senator Kirsten Gillibrand, who hinted that the billâ€™s language was changed to scrap provisions that targeted Trumpâ€™s various crypto projects, which include memecoins, a crypto platform, a stablecoin and a crypto mining company that plans to go public, among others. â€œWhen this language comes out, peopâ€¦

entry.title: Telegram shuts â€˜largest darknet marketplace to have ever existedâ€™
entry.summary: A major Chinese darknet marketplace suspected of facilitating crypto scams and cybercrime has been shut down by the Telegram messaging service, upon which it operated. The internetâ€™s largest illicit marketplace, Haowang Guarantee, formerly Huione Guarantee, said it will shut down following Telegramâ€™s ban of thousands of associated accounts on May 13.Â â€œSince all our NFTs, channels and groups were blocked by Telegram on May 13, 2025, Haowang Guarantee will cease operations from now on,â€ read the notice on the marketplace website. A report from Wired said that this involved banning thousands of accounts and usernames that served as the infrastructure for the crypto crime marketplace and its vendors. Telegram spokesperson Remi Vaughn told the outlet, â€œcommunities previously reported to us by â€¦

entry.title: Chainalysis CEO offers a clue into recent spate of Paris crypto attacks
entry.summary: Some criminal organizations are yet to receive the memo â€” crypto is traceable â€” and could explain the recent string of crypto-related kidnappings, says Chainalysis CEO Jonathan Levin.Â Law enforcement has been increasingly successful at tracing stolen funds and crypto ransom payments, resulting in a â€œlot of arrests,â€ Levin said during the 2025 Consensus crypto conference, covered by Cointelegraph. â€œFor whatever reason, there is a perception thatâ€™s out there that crypto is an asset that is untraceable, and that really lends itself to criminals acting in a certain way,â€ he said.Â â€œApparently, the know that crypto is not untraceable hasn't been received by some of the organized crime groups that are actually perpetrating these attacks, and some of them are concentrated in, you know, France, bâ€¦

entry.title: Europol helps dismantle $23M â€˜mafia crypto bankâ€™
entry.summary: European law enforcement in January arrested 17 suspects of a â€œmafia crypto bankâ€ who are said to have laundered over 21 million euros ($23.5 million) in crypto for criminal entities in China and the Middle East. The money laundering services were allegedly carried out on behalf of other criminal networks engaged in migrant smuggling and drug trafficking, Europol said in a May 14 statement. Spanish authorities said the criminal organization ran a secret informal money transfer system called hawala and was often compensated in crypto. A total of 17 individuals were arrested â€” 15 in Spain, one in Austria and one in Belgium â€” while 4.5 million euros ($5 million) worth of items were seized, including cash, crypto, 18 vehicles, four shotguns and several electronic devices. Of the 4.5 million eâ€¦

entry.title: Democrats seek suspicious activity reports linked to Trump crypto ventures
entry.summary: US Democrat lawmakers have sent a letter to the US Treasury demanding access to suspicious activity reports (SARs) on several Trump-backed crypto projects as part of the latest probe into the presidentâ€™s digital ventures.Â Penned by representatives Gerald Connolly, Joseph Morelle, and Jamie Raskin, the May 14 letter asks Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent for all SARS filed since 2023 related to World Liberty Financial (WLF) and the Official Trump (TRUMP) token.Â Financial institutions in the US must file SARs with the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network, a bureau within the Department of the Treasury, when they detect suspicious activity, including potential money laundering or fraud.Â Source: Oversight Committee Democrats The sweeping probe asks for any SARs mentioning WinRed, America PACâ€¦

Shares in eToro Group Ltd (ETOR) closed May 14 trading at $67, up 28.9% from its initial offering price of $52, according to Yahoo Finance. It brings the companyâ€™s market value to over $5.5 billion. Its stock price shot to a high of $74.26 during the trading day before cooling and has also slightly dipped by 0.7% after the bell to $66.53. entry.title: Crypto startups scaring away VCs with 80x valuations: 10T Holdings
entry.summary: Too many crypto startups are pricing themselves out of venture capital funding by chasing valuations far exceeding their revenues, according to Dan Tapeiro, the CEO of crypto-focused venture capital firm 10T Holdings. â€œFor some reason, founders and CEOs think that they should be raising capital at 50 to 80 times revenue. So that makes it very hard for us to make a return for our liquidity providers,â€ Tapeiro said while speaking in a panel discussion at the Consensus conference in Toronto on May 14. â€œSo a lot of those deals we just pass almost automatically, even businesses that we really like, we won't invest in if the price isn't reasonable in the beginning.â€ 10T Holdings has passed on over 200 companies for similar reasons, including the now-bankrupt FTX, BlockFi and Celsius, Tapeiro saiâ€¦

entry.title: Google search volume for Bitcoin flat as BTC nears new highs â€” Where are retail investors?
entry.summary:
Key takeaways:
Google search data and app rankings show retail Bitcoin investor demand near 6-month lows.
Retail investor interest typically peaks 1 week after BTC breaks all-time highs.
Bitcoin (BTC) retail traders are known for entering the market during periods of euphoria, typically after strong monthly gains or a new all-time high. This time is no different, with Bitcoin approaching $104,000 on May 14 while general public interest and retail activity continue to lag. Analysts estimate that in 2025, retail investors were the largest net sellers of BTC, while institutions were the main buyers. But if historical patterns hold, a surge in retail appetite is likely to occur about one week after Bitcoin surpasses the $109,350 mark. Source: River According to Riverâ€™s estimates, individualâ€¦

entry.title: Ethereum Foundation unveils security initiative to supplant legacy systems
entry.summary: The Ethereum Foundation has launched a security initiative aimed at supporting the broader adoption of onchain technologies, according to a May 14 announcement. The effort is part of an ongoing push to strengthen Ethereum's role in programmable digital assets. Fredrik Svantes, a protocol security research lead, and Josh Stark from the Ethereum Foundation management team will be the initial co-chairs of the initiative. Three contributors to the Ethereum ecosystem â€” samczsun, Medhi Zerouali, and Zach Obront â€” will help guide the project. Called the Trillion Dollar Security Initiative, the effort seeks to analyze, improve, and communicate to Ethereum developers areas where security can be improved, including user experience, wallet security, smart contract security and infrastructure. entry.title: Bitfarms clocks $36M net loss amid shift from Bitcoin mining to AI
entry.summary: Bitfarms clocked a first-quarter net loss of $36 million, widening from a $6 million loss in the same period a year earlier, as the Bitcoin miner pivots from mining to high-performance computing for artificial intelligence applications.Â The miner posted $67 million in sales for the quarter ended March 31, up 33% from the year prior. However, gross profit margin for Bitfarmâ€™s mining operations declined to 43% from 63% year-over-year, the company said in its first quarter earnings release.Â The lower margins reflect pressure from Bitcoinâ€™s (BTC) April 2024 â€œhalvingâ€ as well as volatility in Bitcoinâ€™s price. Halvings occur every four years and cut the number of BTC mined per block in half, reducing Bitcoin minersâ€™ profitability.Â In the first quarter of 2025, Bitcoinâ€™s spot price swung from â€¦

entry.title: Crypto execs flock to DC to support Senate stablecoin bill
entry.summary: Crypto founders headed to Washington, DC, to meet with lawmakers ahead of another expected vote on a stablecoin bill that initially failed in the Senate, according to Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong. In a May 14 X post from the US Capitol rotunda, Armstrong said as many as â€œ60 [crypto] foundersâ€ had gathered in DC to support the Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for US Stablecoins, or GENIUS Act, being considered in the Senate and a draft of the market structure bill moving through the House of Representatives. The Coinbase CEO said the Senate could consider another vote on the GENIUS Act â€œhopefully tomorrowâ€ after it failed to get enough support from Democrats on May 8. â€œLike any good negotiation, thereâ€™s a lot of details to work out at the last minute, but weâ€™ve been stressing â€¦

entry.title: Five crypto figures who disappeared, died â€” or maybe didnâ€™t
entry.summary: Zerebro developer Jeffy Yu has been found alive at his parentsâ€™ home in San Francisco, days after faking his suicide on a livestream that launched a supposed posthumous memecoin past $100 million. Yuâ€™s case isnâ€™t the first time crypto has blurred the line between real death, faked death and something in between.Â From missing founders to sealed caskets, the industry has a long history of exits that left behind more questions than closure. Here are five unsettling cases â€” real, staged or unresolved â€” that continue to haunt the crypto world. 1. Jeffy Yu faked his death, then his crypto pumped A clip of Yu broadcasting his â€œsuicideâ€ circulated on May 4. The video showed him smoking a cigarette before pulling the trigger, then the camera dropped. Hours later, a scheduled social media post annoâ€¦

entry.title: Canada â€˜got it wrongâ€™ labeling stablecoins securities â€” NDAX exec
entry.summary: Tanim Rasul, chief operating officer at Canadian crypto exchange NDAX, said Canada â€œgot it wrongâ€ categorizing stablecoins as securities in 2022, and the country needs to realize that every other regulatory regime is looking at stablecoins as payment instruments. Rasul made the remarks during a panel on May 13 at the Blockchain Futurist Conference in Toronto, pointing to Europe's crypto regulatory framework as a model for Canada to consider: â€œIâ€™m sure the regulators are wondering if this was the right choice to approach stablecoins as a security. [â€¦] I would just say, look at MiCA, look at the way theyâ€™re approaching stablecoins. Itâ€™s a payment instrument. It should be regulated as such.â€ The Canadian Securities Administrators (CSA) classified stablecoins as â€œsecurities and/or derivativesâ€â€¦

entry.title: CFTC commissioner will step down to become Blockchain Association CEO
entry.summary: Update (May 14 at 6:58 pm UTC): This article has been updated to include comments from the Blockchain Association. Summer Mersinger, one of four commissioners currently serving at the US financial regulatory body Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), will become the next CEO of the digital asset advocacy group the Blockchain Association (BA).Â In a May 14 notice, the Blockchain Association said its current CEO, Kristin Smith, would step down for Mersinger on May 16, allowing an interim head of the group to work until the CFTC commissioner assumes the role on June 2. Though her term at the CFTC was expected to last until April 2028, the BA said Mersinger is set to leave the agency on May 30. The departure of Mersinger, who has served in one of the CFTCâ€™s Republican seats since 2022, â€¦
